splash.title: Welcome to Keemiline
splash.subtitle: Chemistry Learning Games
splash.desc: Master the fundamentals of chemical bonding with engaging mini-games that make learning chemistry fun and interactive.

hub.title: Game Hub
hub.bondFormationDesc: Learn how chemical bonds form between atoms
hub.bondTypesSortingDesc: Classify different types of chemical bonds
hub.electronegativityMatchDesc: Match elements with their electronegativity values
hub.bondPolarityQuizDesc: Determine if bonds are polar or nonpolar
hub.moleculeBuilderDesc: Build molecules by selecting atoms and bond types
hub.bondBasketCatcherDesc: Catch only the bond types your basket accepts right now

bondFormation.title: Chemical Bond Formation
bondFormation.instructions: Learn how chemical bonds form between atoms
bondFormation.dragHint: Drag an atom onto another atom to try forming a bond
bondFormation.noBond: {atom1} and {atom2} don't form a stable bond in this exercise. Try different combinations!
bondFormation.needToPass: You need at least {score} correct bonds to pass. Try again!
bondFormation.successMessage: Excellent! You've successfully formed all the chemical bonds!

nacl.name: Sodium Chloride (Table Salt)
nacl.explanation: Sodium loses 1 electron to chlorine, forming Na⁺ and Cl⁻ ions that attract each other. This is an ionic bond formed by electron transfer.

h2.name: Hydrogen Gas
h2.explanation: Two hydrogen atoms share their electrons to form a stable molecule. This is a covalent bond formed by electron sharing.

mgo.name: Magnesium Oxide
mgo.explanation: Magnesium loses 2 electrons to oxygen, forming Mg²⁺ and O²⁻ ions that attract each other. This is an ionic bond.

co2-partial.name: Carbon-Oxygen Bond
co2-partial.explanation: Carbon and oxygen share electrons to form a double covalent bond. In CO₂, carbon forms double bonds with two oxygen atoms.

bondTypesSorting.title: Chemical Bond Types
bondTypesSorting.instructions: Drag each item to the correct category
bondTypesSorting.needToPass: You need at least {score} correct to pass. Try again!
bondTypesSorting.successMessage: Great job! You correctly identified all chemical bonds.
bondTypesSorting.ionicExplanation: Ionic bonds are chemical bonds formed when electrons are transferred from one atom to another, creating charged ions that attract each other.
bondTypesSorting.covalentExplanation: Covalent bonds are chemical bonds where atoms share electrons to achieve stable electron configurations.
bondTypesSorting.metallicExplanation: Metallic bonds are chemical bonds where electrons are shared among many atoms in a "sea of electrons," common in metals.
bondTypesSorting.hydrogenExplanation: Hydrogen bonds are intermolecular forces (not true chemical bonds) between molecules containing hydrogen and electronegative atoms.
bondTypesSorting.vanderWaalsExplanation: Van der Waals forces are weak intermolecular attractions (not chemical bonds) between molecules or parts of molecules.

ionic.name: Ionic Bond
ionic.explanation: Ionic bonds are chemical bonds formed when electrons are transferred from one atom to another, creating charged ions that attract each other.

covalent.name: Covalent Bond
covalent.explanation: Covalent bonds are chemical bonds where atoms share electrons to achieve stable electron configurations.

metallic.name: Metallic Bond
metallic.explanation: Metallic bonds are chemical bonds where electrons are shared among many atoms in a "sea of electrons," common in metals.

hydrogen.name: Hydrogen Bond
hydrogen.explanation: Hydrogen bonds are intermolecular forces (not true chemical bonds) between molecules containing hydrogen and electronegative atoms.

vanderwaals.name: Van der Waals Forces
vanderwaals.explanation: Van der Waals forces are weak intermolecular attractions (not chemical bonds) between molecules or parts of molecules.

electronegativityMatch.title: Electronegativity Match
electronegativityMatch.instructions: Match each element with its electronegativity value
electronegativityMatch.dragHint: Drag electronegativity values onto the corresponding elements
electronegativityMatch.needToPass: You need at least {score} correct matches to pass. Try again!

bondPolarityQuiz.title: Bond Polarity Quiz
bondPolarityQuiz.instructions: Determine if each bond is polar or nonpolar based on electronegativity difference
bondPolarityQuiz.dragHint: Drag bonds to the correct category based on their polarity
bondPolarityQuiz.needToPass: You need at least {score} correct to pass. Try again!
bondPolarityQuiz.successMessage: Great job! You understand bond polarity!

h2.explanation: Two identical atoms have no electronegativity difference, so the bond is nonpolar.

hcl.explanation: Chlorine (3.0) is more electronegative than hydrogen (2.1), creating a polar bond.

nacl.explanation: Large electronegativity difference (2.1) creates a highly polar/ionic bond.

o2.explanation: Identical atoms share electrons equally, resulting in a nonpolar bond.

h2o.explanation: Oxygen (3.5) is more electronegative than hydrogen (2.1), making O-H bonds polar.

co2_co.explanation: Oxygen (3.5) is more electronegative than carbon (2.5), creating polar C=O bonds.

n2.explanation: Two nitrogen atoms share electrons equally in a nonpolar triple bond.

ch.explanation: Small electronegativity difference (0.4) makes C-H bonds essentially nonpolar.

nh.explanation: Nitrogen (3.0) is more electronegative than hydrogen (2.1), creating polar bonds.

cl2.explanation: Two chlorine atoms share electrons equally in a nonpolar bond.

moleculeBuilder.title: Molecule Builder
moleculeBuilder.instructions: Build molecules by selecting the correct atoms and bond types
moleculeBuilder.selectAtoms: Click atoms below to add them to your molecule
moleculeBuilder.needToPass: You need at least {score} correct molecules to pass. Try again!
moleculeBuilder.successMessage: Excellent! You built all the molecules correctly!

water.name: Water
water.hint: One oxygen atom bonds with two hydrogen atoms
water.explanation: Water has two O-H covalent bonds with a bent molecular geometry due to two lone pairs on oxygen.

methane.name: Methane
methane.hint: One carbon atom bonds with four hydrogen atoms
methane.explanation: Methane has four C-H covalent bonds arranged in a tetrahedral shape.

ammonia.name: Ammonia
ammonia.hint: One nitrogen atom bonds with three hydrogen atoms
ammonia.explanation: Ammonia has three N-H covalent bonds with a trigonal pyramidal shape due to one lone pair on nitrogen.

carbonDioxide.name: Carbon Dioxide
carbonDioxide.hint: One carbon atom double-bonds with two oxygen atoms
carbonDioxide.explanation: Carbon dioxide has two C=O double bonds arranged in a linear geometry.

hydrogenChloride.name: Hydrogen Chloride
hydrogenChloride.hint: One hydrogen atom bonds with one chlorine atom
hydrogenChloride.explanation: HCl is a diatomic molecule with one polar covalent bond.

sodiumChloride.name: Sodium Chloride
sodiumChloride.hint: Sodium loses an electron to chlorine
sodiumChloride.explanation: NaCl forms through ionic bonding where Na donates an electron to Cl.

bondBasketCatcher.title: Basket Game
bondBasketCatcher.instructions: Move the basket and catch only the bond types it accepts right now.
bondBasketCatcher.successMessage: Great reflexes! You sorted bond types under pressure.
bondBasketCatcher.needToPass: You need at least {score} correct catches to pass. Try again!
bondBasketCatcher.playAreaAria: Game area for moving basket and catching falling bond items
